page.title: 03TRANSPORT-THE RAILWAY LINE
page.content: The railway line runs between Congleton and Macclesfield.It is double track.It crosses the Macclesfield Canal by bridge and the River Dane on a viaduct.Most of the trains are electric.The line is used by people commuting to work in Macclesfield,Manchester and Stoke-on-Trent.The price of a ticket from Congleton to Macclesfield is Â£1.00 for an adult and 50p for a child. From Congleton to Stoke-on-Trent it is Â£1.30 for adults and 65p for children.There are 40 trains a day except Sunday when there are only 10 trains going up and down. They have nine to eleven carriages on the expresses and three to four carriages on local trains. The goods trains carry only small livestock like rabbits and birds e.g.racing pigeons.
